Articles.Content:
30 minutes ago, Shalfar said:

Heads up for anyone who is seeing things in strange places (i.e. Arakebo on its side on top of KSC) with 1.4.5.26.  If you installed from CKAN you are missing a folder. Now if someone can help me with the square of arrows that thinks it's KSC2 and attaches itself to my planes I would be very appreciative.

Can you please delete and reinstall the mod? 

I can not reproduce the the issue.

7 hours ago, Ger_space said:

Can you please delete and reinstall the mod? 

I can not reproduce the the issue. 

Still there.  I would attach a screen shot if I could figure out how. I dug through logs but didn't find anything.

Same problem, just started it half an hour ago, was updating kerbalism so i also updated kerbinside.

@Shalfar

https://imgur.com/a/FhzWAZi

Same problem, just started it half an hour ago, was updating kerbalism so i also updated kerbinside.

@Shalfar

https://imgur.com/a/FhzWAZi

Then try to delete distant object enhancements

How did you install the mods? Manually or with ckan? 

I'm confused, why I don't have the problems.

You should not install Kerbin side core together with Kerbin-side side complete.

 

Edited December 18, 2018 by Ger_space

I installed with CKAN, and it makes kerbinside core a dependency to the complete.

https://imgur.com/a/QYDrTvc

Edited December 18, 2018 by SaelbenNoa

9 minutes ago, SaelbenNoa said:

I installed with CKAN, and it makes kerbinside core a dependency to the complete.

https://imgur.com/a/QYDrTvc

Then ckan f... It up. The package is stand alone. 

Could you please delete the directories from your install and install the mods manually? 

I just want to know if the problem persists, or if something else is happening
Okay, I reinstalled using CKAN and the problem is still there, I will now try manual install.
manually installed only the complete, problem persists

having the same problem..

The launch site is even in the title screen...

It appears on every selected vessel..

screenshot

 

Downloading "https://github.com/Li0n-0/CrewLight/releases/download/v1.18/CrewLight-1.18.zip"
Downloading "https://spacedock.info/mod/1774/Kerbalism/download/2.1.0.0"
Downloading "https://spacedock.info/mod/1347/Kerbin-Side%20Complete%20continued/download/1.4.5.26"
Module "Crew Light" successfully installed
Module "Kerbalism" successfully installed
Module "Kerbin-Side Complete continued" successfully installed
Module "KerbinSide Core" successfully installed

 

I made a "beyond compare" crc-diff over the ckan installation and the manual downloaded and extracted zip , and there was no difference

I reinstalled 1.4.5.25. this version is fine.

Edited December 18, 2018 by eldorim

7 hours ago, Ger_space said:

Then ckan f... It up. The package is stand alone. 

Could you please delete the directories from your install and install the mods manually? 

I just want to know if the problem persists, or if something else is happening 

HebaruSan is aware of the install issue from CKAN and has a fix in the works.  Clean install from Spacedock gives me the following weirdness. https://drive.google.com/open?id=1U54QFNHBFb9kvPJCmTx91Pp68RQytxKq

I do have a crap ton of mods installed, so I'm going to try with a completely KSP and see what happens.

I can now say it does happen with a clean KSP having only Kerbal-Konstructs and Kerbin-Side Complete.

Edited December 18, 2018 by Shalfar
More Info
The fix listed on the Kerbal Konstructs page fixes the issue.  Thank you @Ger_space
I am experiencing a bug where the space center teleports to the KerbinSide base I used last (i.e. if I used Ben Bay last, my space center screen would be of Ben Bay). Help?

1 hour ago, DunaMoose1977 said:

I am experiencing a bug where the space center teleports to the KerbinSide base I used last (i.e. if I used Ben Bay last, my space center screen would be of Ben Bay). Help?

It's not  a bug, it's a feature. You can disable it in the settings of kerbal konstructs

don't reply to this

Edited January 3, 2019 by siklidkid
i

24 minutes ago, siklidkid said:

don't reply to this

Okay.

8 minutes ago, Beetlecat said:

Okay.

but you replied to it.

Is there something I need to do in order to improve the recovery factor when landing someplace besides KSC?  I launched and recovered from KSC2, but I only got about a 62% recovery.  The dialog said I was 765km from KSC2 which is clearly wrong.  That's probably the distance from the main KSC.
there could be a glitch with this mod, some of the buildings are floating.

2 hours ago, siklidkid said:

there could be a glitch with this mod, some of the buildings are floating.

Set the terrain details to high.

Everything below is not realy supported.

5 hours ago, BuzzKerman621 said:

Is there something I need to do in order to improve the recovery factor when landing someplace besides KSC?  I launched and recovered from KSC2, but I only got about a 62% recovery.  The dialog said I was 765km from KSC2 which is clearly wrong.  That's probably the distance from the main KSC.

Of the base at the ksc2 is not open, then it will not recover..

10 hours ago, Ger_space said:

Set the terrain details to high.

Everything below is not really supported.

Of the base at the ksc2 is not open, then it will not recover.. 

That fixed it.

wait i have another glitch, i launched my plane from arakebo observatory and now when i open ksp instead of the main ksc it gave me the arakebo observatory, AND when i made  new game, IT STILL SHOWED ME THE SAME PLACE INSTEAD OF THE ORIGINAL KSC.
